description: DEMOLITION OF THE EXISTING REAR GARAGE AND STORES. ERECTION OF REAR EXTENSION TO EXISTING RETAIL UNIT AND ERECTION OF 2 x TWO STOREY BEDROOM DWELLINGHOUSES. ASSOCIATED AMENITY, PARKING AND REFUSE STORES.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed development, by reason of its proximity to the highway, height, width, form and boundary treatment, would result in a cramped appearance which would be materially harmful to the character of the area and the appearance of the streetscene, contrary to Policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, the London Character and Context SPG 2014, Policy CS14 of the Core Planning Strategy 2011 and Policies DM D2 and DM D3 of the Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Reason : 2 - The proposed development, by reason of its height and the proximity of the proposed building to the existing rear facing bedroom window of the existing first floor flat on site (No.219A Manor Road, Mitcham), would result in an overly dominant and materially harmful overbearing impact, which would result in a materially harmful loss of outlook to the existing occupiers, contrary to Policy DM D2 of the Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
